gameobjects

Class Bullet

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameobjects.AbstractGameObject
      • gameobjects.Bullet
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GameObject

    public class Bullet
extends AbstractGameObject
    This class defines a bullet. It has a shooter and a fixed direction according to shooter.

      This method returns the shooter to custody
      void initializeLocation()
      This method sets location on the center of the shooter.
      void moveDirection()
      This method overrides moveDirection() as to not do anything.
      void movePosition()
      Moves the position of the bullet by increasing its position with the fixed velocity.

    • Method Detail

      • getShooter

        public Shooter getShooter()
        This method returns the shooter to custody
        Returns:
        returns the shooter

      • initializeLocation

        public void initializeLocation()
        This method sets location on the center of the shooter. It also sets direction the same as the shooter and fixes the velocity according to direction and a static game play variable.
        Specified by:
        initializeLocation in interface GameObject
        Specified by:
        initializeLocation in class AbstractGameObject

      • movePosition

        public void movePosition()
        Moves the position of the bullet by increasing its position with the fixed velocity. Also kills it if it gets out of bounds.
        Specified by:
        movePosition in interface GameObject
        Specified by:
        movePosition in class AbstractGameObject

      • moveDirection

        public void moveDirection()
        This method overrides moveDirection() as to not do anything. Bullet does not change direction,
        Specified by:
        moveDirection in interface GameObject
        Specified by:
        moveDirection in class AbstractGameObject
